sponsor.partnerMessage: Northwest Arkansas born and bred, Signature Bank of Arkansas provides complete financial services to NWA's small businesses, families, and farms. Our dedication to community banking traditions and personalized customer service sets the Signature Banking experience apart. Open an account here.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Ranked Among Top Five US Growth Markets
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas made the top five in the Top 29 Market Report by Synergos Technologies Inc. ‚Äî a study exploring the US markets experiencing the most growth based on Synergos's novel method.

  • Looking back: Northwest Arkansas ranked fifth for the fastest growth rate in the past two years, following Myrtle Beach, SC; Brevard, FL; St. Lucie, FL; and Volusia, FL.
  • Looking forward: Ranking second for projected future growth rate, Northwest Arkansas is expected to reach a population of 736,832 within the next decade.

Read more on Synergos' blog HERE.

posts.title: Creekside Park In Bentonville Now Open
posts.content:
Bentonville celebrated the grand opening of Creekside Park on Saturday, inviting the community to enjoy 35 acres of fun in one of the city's most innovative public parks.

  • First things first: The $7.9m project boasts Northwest Arkansas's first regulation cricket field and Bentonville's first illuminated dog park for nighttime outings with your pup.
  • Connecting the fun: The park includes a destination splash pad, eight lighted pickleball courts, a playground, a picnic pavilion, and a 1.6-mi bike trail that will eventually provide access south to Bentonville Community Center and north to Osage Park, 8th Street Gateway Park, and Coler Mountain Bike Preserve.

Learn more about this exciting new park HERE.

posts.title: Enter A Wine Wonderland At Walton Art Center
posts.content:
Fall down the rabbit hole into a Wine Wonderland during Walton Arts Center's Annual Art of Wine: Uncorked! celebration, featuring hundreds of wines to sample and small bites from local restaurants on Friday, Jul 21, from 8-11p.

  • The Wine Cellar: General admission tickets start at $95. Reserve Room tickets for exclusive access to premium wines are $200. Get early entry at 7:30p for just $25 per person with an Express Pass.
  • All smiles: Proceeds from the delectable evening support the arts education programs of Walton Arts Center, which serve an average of 35,000 school children and teachers annually through arts education and outreach programs.

Reserve your tickets for Uncorked! HERE.

posts.title: Shiloh Museum Seeks Community Input For Use Of Recent Grant
posts.content:
The Shiloh Museum of Ozark History received an $80,000 Community Placemaking Grant from the Project for Public Spaces and is taking public input on how to use the funds.

  • Unique places: The funding will enable the museum to create an engaging outdoor space, update signage with language for our diverse community, and improve accessibility throughout the grounds.
  • Your story belongs: The museum invites the public to a Community Visioning Workshop to brainstorm and imagine creative uses of the funding on Jun 28 at 5:30p. All ages are welcome to participate!

Register for the Community Visioning Workshop HERE.

posts.title: Celebrate The Fourth At Eureka Springs's Jamboreeka
posts.content:
Celebrate Independence Day at Eureka Springs's Jamboreeka! A family-friendly party featuring live bands, food & beer trucks, and a spectacular fireworks display at Lake Leatherwood Baseball Fields on Jul 2, from 5:30-9:30p.

  • Free ride: Admission is free, though donations to Eureka Springs Parks & Rec are appreciated to offset the cost of the event. A free trolley service will run from Planar Hill Parking Lot, the Transit Visitor Center, and the Transit Downtown Depot.
  • Party time: Enjoy music from Sprungbilly and Los Roscoes, tasty treats from Disco's Grill & Pineapple Paradise, and brews from Gotahold Brewing & Eureka Springs Brewery. Plus, there will be a dunk tank and waterslide, a nature hike, and an E-bike raffle.

Find more event details HERE.
